  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (* Insertion of moves to suggest possible spilling / reloading points
  17.    before register allocation. *)

  19. open Reg
  20. open Mach

  22. (* We say that a register is "destroyed" if it is live across a construct
  23.    that potentially destroys all physical registers: function calls or
  24.    try...with constructs.

  26.    The "destroyed" registers must therefore reside in the stack during
  27.    these instructions.. We will insert spills (stores) just after they
  28.    are defined, and reloads just before their first use following a
  29.    "destroying" construct.

  31.    Instructions with more live registers than actual registers also
  32.    "destroy" registers: we mark as "destroyed" the registers live
  33.    across the instruction that haven't been used for the longest time.
  34.    These registers will be spilled and reloaded as described above. *)

  36. (* Association of spill registers to registers *)

  38. ‌type reload_data = {
  39.   spill_env : Reg.t Reg.Map.t ref;
  40.   mutable use_date : int Reg.Map.t;
  41.     (* Record the position of last use of registers *)
  42.   mutable current_date : int;
  43.   mutable destroyed_at_fork : (instruction * Reg.Set.t) list;
  44.     (* A-list recording what is destroyed at if-then-else points. *)
  45.   reload_at_exit : (int, Reg.Set.t) Hashtbl.t;
  46. }

  48. ‌type spill_data = {
  49.   spill_env : Reg.t Reg.Map.t ref;
  50.   destroyed_at_fork : (instruction * Reg.Set.t) list;
  51.    (* A-list recording what is destroyed at if-then-else points. *)
  52.   mutable spill_at_raise : Reg.Set.t;
  53.   mutable inside_arm : bool;
  54.   mutable inside_catch : bool;
  55.   spill_at_exit : (int, Reg.Set.t) Hashtbl.t;
  56. }

  58. ‌let create_reload () = {
  59.   spill_env = ref Reg.Map.empty;
  60.   use_date = Reg.Map.empty;
  61.   current_date = 0;
  62.   destroyed_at_fork = [];
  63.   reload_at_exit = Hashtbl.create 20;
  64. }

  66. let create_spill (reload : reload_data) = {
  67.   spill_env = reload.spill_env;
  68.   destroyed_at_fork = reload.destroyed_at_fork;
  69.   spill_at_raise = Reg.Set.empty;
  70.   inside_arm = false;
  71.   inside_catch = false;
  72.   spill_at_exit = Hashtbl.create 20;
  73. }

  75. let spill_reg spill_env r =
  76.   try
  77.     Reg.Map.find r !spill_env
  78.   with Not_found ->
  79.     let spill_r = Reg.create r.typ in
  80.     spill_r.spill <- true;
  81.     if not (Reg.anonymous r) then spill_r.raw_name <- r.raw_name;
  82.     spill_env := Reg.Map.add r spill_r !spill_env;
  83.     spill_r

  85. let record_use t regv =
  86.   for i = 0 to Array.length regv - 1 do
  87.     let r = regv.(i) in
  88.     let prev_date = try Reg.Map.find r t.use_date with Not_found -> 0 in
  89.     if t.current_date > prev_date then
  90.       t.use_date <- Reg.Map.add r t.current_date t.use_date
  91.   done

  93. (* Check if the register pressure overflows the maximum pressure allowed
  94.    at that point. If so, spill enough registers to lower the pressure. *)

  96. let add_superpressure_regs t op live_regs res_regs spilled =
  97.   let max_pressure = Proc.max_register_pressure op in
  98.   let regs = Reg.add_set_array live_regs res_regs in
  99.   (* Compute the pressure in each register class *)
  100.   let pressure = Array.make Proc.num_register_classes 0 in
  101.   Reg.Set.iter
  102.     (fun r ->
  103.       if Reg.Set.mem r spilled then () else begin
  104.         match r.loc with
  105.           Stack _ -> ()
  106.         | _ -> let c = Proc.register_class r in
  107.                pressure.(c) <- pressure.(c) + 1
  108.       end)
  109.     regs;
  110.   (* Check if pressure is exceeded for each class. *)
  111. ‌  let rec check_pressure cl spilled =
  112.     if cl >= Proc.num_register_classes then
  113.       spilled
  114.     else if pressure.(cl) <= max_pressure.(cl) then
  115.       check_pressure (cl+1) spilled
  116.     else begin
  117.       (* Find the least recently used, unspilled, unallocated, live register
  118.          in the class *)
  119.       let lru_date = ref 1000000 and lru_reg = ref Reg.dummy in
  120.       Reg.Set.iter
  121.         (fun r ->
  122.           if Proc.register_class r = cl &&
  123.              not (Reg.Set.mem r spilled) &&
  124.              r.loc = Unknown
  125.           then begin
  126.             try
  127.               let d = Reg.Map.find r t.use_date in
  128.               if d < !lru_date then begin
  129.                 lru_date := d;
  130.                 lru_reg := r
  131.               end
  132.             with Not_found ->                 (* Should not happen *)
  133.               ()
  134.           end)
  135.         live_regs;
  136.       if !lru_reg != Reg.dummy then begin
  137.         pressure.(cl) <- pressure.(cl) - 1;
  138.         check_pressure cl (Reg.Set.add !lru_reg spilled)
  139.       end else
  140.         (* Couldn't find any spillable register, give up for this class *)
  141.         check_pressure (cl+1) spilled
  142.     end in
  143.   check_pressure 0 spilled

  145. (* First pass: insert reload instructions based on an approximation of
  146.    what is destroyed at pressure points. *)

  148. ‌let add_reloads spill_env regset i =
  149.   Reg.Set.fold
  150.     (fun r i -> instr_cons (Iop Ireload) [|spill_reg spill_env r|] [|r|] i)
  151.     regset i

  153. let get_reload_at_exit t k =
  154.   match Hashtbl.find_opt t.reload_at_exit k with
  155.   | None -> Reg.Set.empty
  156.   | Some s -> s

  158. ‌let set_reload_at_exit t k s =
  159.   Hashtbl.replace t.reload_at_exit k s

  161. ‌let rec reload (t : reload_data) i before =
  162.   t.current_date <- succ t.current_date;
  163.   record_use t i.arg;
  164.   record_use t i.res;
  165.   match i.desc with
  166.     Iend ->
  167.       (i, before)
  168.   | Ireturn | Iop(Itailcall_ind) | Iop(Itailcall_imm _) ->
  169.       (add_reloads t.spill_env (Reg.inter_set_array before i.arg) i,
  170.        Reg.Set.empty)
  171.   | Iop(Icall_ind | Icall_imm _ | Iextcall { alloc = true; }) ->
  172.       (* All regs live across must be spilled *)
  173.       let (new_next, finally) = reload t i.next i.live in
  174.       (add_reloads t.spill_env (Reg.inter_set_array before i.arg)
  175.                    (instr_cons_debug i.desc i.arg i.res i.dbg new_next),
  176.        finally)
  177.   | Iop op ->
  178.       let new_before =
  179.         (* Quick check to see if the register pressure is below the maximum *)
  180.         if !Clflags.use_linscan ||
  181.            (Reg.Set.cardinal i.live + Array.length i.res <=
  182.             Proc.safe_register_pressure op)
  183.         then before
  184.         else add_superpressure_regs t op i.live i.res before in
  185. ‌      let after =
  186.         Reg.diff_set_array (Reg.diff_set_array new_before i.arg) i.res in
  187. ‌      let (new_next, finally) = reload t i.next after in
  188.       (add_reloads t.spill_env (Reg.inter_set_array new_before i.arg)
  189.                    (instr_cons_debug i.desc i.arg i.res i.dbg new_next),
  190.        finally)
  191.   | Iifthenelse(test, ifso, ifnot) ->
  192. ‌      let at_fork = Reg.diff_set_array before i.arg in
  193. ‌      let date_fork = t.current_date in
  194. ‌      let (new_ifso, after_ifso) = reload t ifso at_fork in
  195. ‌      let date_ifso = t.current_date in
  196.       t.current_date <- date_fork;
  197. ‌      let (new_ifnot, after_ifnot) = reload t ifnot at_fork in
  198.       t.current_date <- Int.max date_ifso t.current_date;
  199. ‌      let (new_next, finally) =
  200.         reload t i.next (Reg.Set.union after_ifso after_ifnot) in
  201. ‌      let new_i =
  202.         instr_cons (Iifthenelse(test, new_ifso, new_ifnot))
  203.         i.arg i.res new_next in
  204.       t.destroyed_at_fork <- (new_i, at_fork) :: t.destroyed_at_fork;
  205.       (add_reloads t.spill_env (Reg.inter_set_array before i.arg) new_i,
  206.        finally)
  207.   | Iswitch(index, cases) ->
  208. ‌      let at_fork = Reg.diff_set_array before i.arg in
  209. ‌      let date_fork = t.current_date in
  210. ‌      let date_join = ref 0 in
  211. ‌      let after_cases = ref Reg.Set.empty in
  212. ‌      let new_cases =
  213.         Array.map
  214.           (fun c ->
  215.             t.current_date <- date_fork;
  216.             let (new_c, after_c) = reload t c at_fork in
  217.             after_cases := Reg.Set.union !after_cases after_c;
  218.             date_join := Int.max !date_join t.current_date;
  219.             new_c)
  220.           cases in
  221.       t.current_date <- !date_join;
  222. ‌      let (new_next, finally) = reload t i.next !after_cases in
  223.       (add_reloads t.spill_env (Reg.inter_set_array before i.arg)
  224.                    (instr_cons (Iswitch(index, new_cases))
  225.                                i.arg i.res new_next),
  226.        finally)
  227.   | Icatch(rec_flag, handlers, body) ->
  228. ‌      let (new_body, after_body) = reload t body before in
  229. ‌      let rec fixpoint () =
  230.         let at_exits =
  231.           List.map (fun (nfail, _) -> (nfail, get_reload_at_exit t nfail))
  232.                    handlers in
  233.         let res =
  234.           List.map2
  235.             (fun (nfail', handler) (nfail, at_exit) ->
  236.               assert(nfail = nfail');
  237.               reload t handler at_exit)
  238.             handlers at_exits in
  239.         match rec_flag with
  240.         | Cmm.Nonrecursive ->
  241.             res
  242.         | Cmm.Recursive ->
  243.             let equal =
  244.               List.for_all2
  245.                 (fun (nfail', _) (nfail, at_exit) ->
  246.                   assert(nfail = nfail');
  247.                   Reg.Set.equal at_exit (get_reload_at_exit t nfail))
  248.                 handlers at_exits in
  249.             if equal
  250.             then res
  251.             else fixpoint ()
  252.       in
  253. ‌      let res = fixpoint () in
  254. ‌      let union = List.fold_left
  255.           (fun acc (_, after_handler) -> Reg.Set.union acc after_handler)
  256.           after_body res in
  257. ‌      let (new_next, finally) = reload t i.next union in
  258. ‌      let new_handlers = List.map2
  259.           (fun (nfail, _) (new_handler, _) -> nfail, new_handler)
  260.           handlers res in
  261.       (instr_cons
  262.          (Icatch(rec_flag, new_handlers, new_body)) i.arg i.res new_next,
  263.        finally)
  264.   | Iexit nfail ->
  265.       set_reload_at_exit t nfail
  266.                          (Reg.Set.union (get_reload_at_exit t nfail) before);
  267.       (i, Reg.Set.empty)
  268.   | Itrywith(body, handler) ->
  269. ‌      let (new_body, after_body) = reload t body before in
  270.       (* All registers live at the beginning of the handler are destroyed,
  271.          except the exception bucket *)
  272. ‌      let before_handler =
  273.         Reg.Set.remove Proc.loc_exn_bucket
  274.                        (Reg.add_set_array handler.live handler.arg) in
  275. ‌      let (new_handler, after_handler) = reload t handler before_handler in
  276. ‌      let (new_next, finally) =
  277.         reload t i.next (Reg.Set.union after_body after_handler) in
  278.       (instr_cons (Itrywith(new_body, new_handler)) i.arg i.res new_next,
  279.        finally)
  280.   | Iraise _ ->
  281.       (add_reloads
  282.          t.spill_env (Reg.inter_set_array before i.arg) i, Reg.Set.empty)

  284. (* Second pass: add spill instructions based on what we've decided to reload.
  285.    That is, any register that may be reloaded in the future must be spilled
  286.    just after its definition. *)

  288. (*
  289.    As an optimization, if a register needs to be spilled in one branch of
  290.    a conditional but not in the other, then we spill it late on entrance
  291.    in the branch that needs it spilled.
  292.    NB: This strategy is turned off in loops, as it may prevent a spill from
  293.    being lifted up all the way out of the loop.
  294.    NB again: This strategy is also off in switch arms
  295.    as it generates many useless spills inside switch arms
  296.    NB ter: is it the same thing for catch bodies ?
  297. *)

  299. ‌let get_spill_at_exit t k =
  300.   match Hashtbl.find_opt t.spill_at_exit k with
  301.   | None -> Reg.Set.empty
  302.   | Some s -> s

  304. ‌let set_spill_at_exit t k s =
  305.   Hashtbl.replace t.spill_at_exit k s

  307. ‌let add_spills t regset i =
  308.   Reg.Set.fold
  309.     (fun r i -> instr_cons (Iop Ispill) [|r|] [|spill_reg t r|] i)
  310.     regset i

  312. let rec spill (t : spill_data) i finally =
  313.   match i.desc with
  314.     Iend ->
  315.       (i, finally)
  316.   | Ireturn | Iop(Itailcall_ind) | Iop(Itailcall_imm _) ->
  317.       (i, Reg.Set.empty)
  318.   | Iop Ireload ->
  319.       let (new_next, after) = spill t i.next finally in
  320.       let before1 = Reg.diff_set_array after i.res in
  321.       (instr_cons i.desc i.arg i.res new_next,
  322.        Reg.add_set_array before1 i.res)
  323.   | Iop op ->
  324.       let (new_next, after) = spill t i.next finally in
  325.       let before1 = Reg.diff_set_array after i.res in
  326.       let before =
  327.         if operation_can_raise op
  328.         then Reg.Set.union before1 t.spill_at_raise
  329.         else before1 in
  330.       (instr_cons_debug i.desc i.arg i.res i.dbg
  331.          (add_spills t.spill_env (Reg.inter_set_array after i.res) new_next),
  332.        before)
  333.   | Iifthenelse(test, ifso, ifnot) ->
  334. ‌      let (new_next, at_join) = spill t i.next finally in
  335. ‌      let (new_ifso, before_ifso) = spill t ifso at_join in
  336. ‌      let (new_ifnot, before_ifnot) = spill t ifnot at_join in
  337.       if
  338.         t.inside_arm || t.inside_catch
  339.       then
  340.         (instr_cons (Iifthenelse(test, new_ifso, new_ifnot))
  341.                      i.arg i.res new_next,
  342.          Reg.Set.union before_ifso before_ifnot)
  343.       else begin
  344. ‌        let destroyed = List.assq i t.destroyed_at_fork in
  345. ‌        let spill_ifso_branch =
  346.           Reg.Set.diff (Reg.Set.diff before_ifso before_ifnot) destroyed
  347.         and spill_ifnot_branch =
  348.           Reg.Set.diff (Reg.Set.diff before_ifnot before_ifso) destroyed in
  349.         (instr_cons
  350.            (Iifthenelse(test,
  351.                         add_spills t.spill_env spill_ifso_branch new_ifso,
  352.                         add_spills t.spill_env spill_ifnot_branch new_ifnot))
  353.             i.arg i.res new_next,
  354.          Reg.Set.diff (Reg.Set.diff (Reg.Set.union before_ifso before_ifnot)
  355.                                     spill_ifso_branch)
  356.                        spill_ifnot_branch)
  357.       end
  358.   | Iswitch(index, cases) ->
  359. ‌      let (new_next, at_join) = spill t i.next finally in
  360. ‌      let saved_inside_arm = t.inside_arm in
  361.       t.inside_arm <- true ;
  362. ‌      let before = ref Reg.Set.empty in
  363. ‌      let new_cases =
  364.         Array.map
  365.           (fun c ->
  366.             let (new_c, before_c) = spill t c at_join in
  367.             before := Reg.Set.union !before before_c;
  368.             new_c)
  369.           cases in
  370.       t.inside_arm <- saved_inside_arm ;
  371.       (instr_cons (Iswitch(index, new_cases)) i.arg i.res new_next,
  372.        !before)
  373.   | Icatch(rec_flag, handlers, body) ->
  374. ‌      let (new_next, at_join) = spill t i.next finally in
  375. ‌      let saved_inside_catch = t.inside_catch in
  376.       t.inside_catch <- true ;
  377. ‌      let rec fixpoint () =
  378.         let res =
  379.           List.map (fun (_, handler) -> spill t handler at_join) handlers in
  380.         let update changed (k, _handler) (_new_handler, before_handler) =
  381.           if Reg.Set.equal before_handler (get_spill_at_exit t k)
  382.           then changed
  383.           else (set_spill_at_exit t k before_handler; true) in
  384. ‌        let changed =
  385.           List.fold_left2 update false handlers res in
  386.         if rec_flag = Cmm.Recursive && changed
  387.         then fixpoint ()
  388.         else res
  389.       in
  390. ‌      let res = fixpoint () in
  391.       t.inside_catch <- saved_inside_catch ;
  392. ‌      let (new_body, before) = spill t body at_join in
  393. ‌      let new_handlers = List.map2
  394.           (fun (nfail, _) (new_handler, _) -> (nfail, new_handler))
  395.           handlers res in
  396.       (instr_cons (Icatch(rec_flag, new_handlers, new_body))
  397.          i.arg i.res new_next,
  398.        before)
  399.   | Iexit nfail ->
  400.       (i, get_spill_at_exit t nfail)
  401.   | Itrywith(body, handler) ->
  402. ‌      let (new_next, at_join) = spill t i.next finally in
  403. ‌      let (new_handler, before_handler) = spill t handler at_join in
  404. ‌      let saved_spill_at_raise = t.spill_at_raise in
  405.       t.spill_at_raise <- before_handler;
  406. ‌      let (new_body, before_body) = spill t body at_join in
  407.       t.spill_at_raise <- saved_spill_at_raise;
  408.       (instr_cons (Itrywith(new_body, new_handler)) i.arg i.res new_next,
  409.        before_body)
  410.   | Iraise _ ->
  411.       (i, t.spill_at_raise)

  413. (* Entry point *)

  415. ‌let fundecl f =
  416.   let reload_data = create_reload () in
  417.   let (body1, _) = reload reload_data f.fun_body Reg.Set.empty in
  418.   let spill_data = create_spill reload_data in
  419.   let (body2, tospill_at_entry) = spill spill_data body1 Reg.Set.empty in
  420.   let new_body =
  421.     add_spills
  422.       spill_data.spill_env
  423.       (Reg.inter_set_array tospill_at_entry f.fun_args)
  424.       body2
  425.   in
  426.   { fun_name = f.fun_name;
  427.     fun_args = f.fun_args;
  428.     fun_body = new_body;
  429.     fun_codegen_options = f.fun_codegen_options;
  430.     fun_poll = f.fun_poll;
  431.     fun_dbg  = f.fun_dbg;
  432.     fun_num_stack_slots = f.fun_num_stack_slots;
  433.     fun_contains_calls = f.fun_contains_calls;
  434.   }

One Level Up Top Level
